intro: Psychotria microbotrys, commonly known as the "Little Ghost Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria microbotrys is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
